questionListItems.title: How will I remember everyone’s name?

answer.body: By simply chatting with them! But if you do forget, you can always check out our HR portal, BambooHR where we have names and photos of our team members.

questionListItems.title: Is OGP looking for data scientists?
questionListItems.body: I'm a data scientist looking to apply to OGP. Would you consider my application?

answer.body:
We are not taking data science interns and are not actively hiring full-time data scientists. That being said, we’re open to considering strong profiles (e.g. relevant study, shown experience) for data science roles who can work independently.
Interested people can send their CVs over to recruiting@open.gov.sg

questionListItems.title: Are interns given a chance for conversion to full-time?
questionListItems.body: Just curious if interns can be converted to full-timers.

answer.body:
Yes, though this is predicated on the availability of roles in the team. We assess interns on-the-job for whether they have the potential for full-time conversion and offer them a chance for a conversion interview if they are suitable.
To date, we’ve made quite a few conversion offers to interns, and many of our current team members used to be interns on the team

questionListItems.title: What roles does OGP hire interns for?
questionListItems.body: I'm looking for an internship this summer. Would like to know what are the opening roles in OGP.

answer.body:
We are hiring for select intern positions, as published on our website.
We are currently full for Design and SWE internships for 2023 summer.
We do not take PM or Data Science/Analytics interns

questionListItems.title: I’ve applied before. When can I re-apply?
questionListItems.body: Hi, I applied at OGP before but was not successful. When can I re-apply?

answer.body: We are generally happy to consider re-applications 6 months after the previous one. Principally, we do this so that there is sufficient time for an applicant to build up additional experience in that 6 months for us to re-assess.
